page.title: 06Kennoway Primary School -1
page.content:
Kennoway Primary School is a large school with a roll of 511; a 50- place nursery; a staff complement of 25; a janitor and staff of 8; a cook and staff of 8; a teaching auxiliary; a classroom auxiliary and 4 nursery assistants. Specialist teachers of Physical Education, Art, Music and Drama visit the school regularly.
The building presently occupied was originally built as a secondary school and later used as a Fife Region Multi-media Resources Centre.
The school has for the past seven years,therefore, enjoyed the advantages of extensive playing fields, a large assembly hall with separate dining facilities and a gymnasium with showers and changing rooms.
